channel.title: CVE Feed for reputeinfosystems -- Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin – BookingPress
channel.description: The latest CVEs for reputeinfosystems -- Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin – BookingPress

item.title: CVE-2024-6660|2024-07-17T06:45:09.895Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data that can lead to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the bookingpress_import_data_continue_process_func function in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to update arbitrary options on the WordPress site and upload arbitrary files. This can be leveraged to update the default role for registration to administrator and enable user registration for attackers to gain administrative user access to a vulnerable site.

item.title: CVE-2024-6467|2024-07-17T06:45:11.571Z -- reputeinfosystems -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20plugin%20and%20online%20scheduling%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20bookingpress
item.description: The BookingPress – Appointment Booking Calendar Plugin and Online Scheduling Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read to Arbitrary File Creation in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5 via the 'bookingpress_save_lite_wizard_settings_func' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to create arbitrary files that contain the content of files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files or the exposure of sensitive information.
